message.content:
cs.AI, cs.DB, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR. 

The paper presents a fact checking method that uses knowledge graphs (KGs) and logical rule discovery to assess claims and explain its decisions. This involves exploiting the rich semantics of KGs to produce interpretable explanations for the fact checking output. The paper also models the checking task as an inference problem in a probabilistic extension of answer set programs. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.DB (Databases), followed by cs.CL (Computation and Language), cs.LG (Machine Learning), and cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
